detailed.description: Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.
detailed.title: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks

broad.title: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service

detailed.description: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Use hand or mail handling machines to time stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.
detailed.title: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service

detailed.description: Perform duties too varied and diverse to be classified in any specific office clerical occupation, requiring knowledge of office systems and procedures. Clerical duties may be assigned in accordance with the office procedures of individual establishments and may include a combination of answering telephones, bookkeeping, typing or word processing, stenography, office machine operation, and filing.
detailed.title: Office Clerks, General

detailed.description: Operate one or more of a variety of office machines, such as photocopying, photographic, and duplicating machines, or other office machines.
detailed.title: Office Machine Operators, Except Computer

detailed.description: Read transcript or proof type setup to detect and mark for correction any grammatical, typographical, or compositional errors. Includes proofreaders of Braille.
detailed.title: Proofreaders and Copy Markers

detailed.description: Compile and compute data according to statistical formulas for use in statistical studies. May perform actuarial computations and compile charts and graphs for use by actuaries. Includes actuarial clerks.
detailed.title: Statistical Assistants

broad.title: Miscellaneous Office and Administrative Support Workers

detailed.description: All office and administrative support workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Office and Administrative Support Workers, All Other

minor.title: Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of agricultural, forestry, aquacultural, and related workers.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers

detailed.description: Inspect agricultural commodities, processing equipment, and facilities, and fish and logging operations, to ensure compliance with regulations and laws governing health, quality, and safety.
detailed.title: Agricultural Inspectors

detailed.description: Select and breed animals according to their genealogy, characteristics, and offspring. May require knowledge of artificial insemination techniques and equipment use. May involve keeping records on heats, birth intervals, or pedigree.
detailed.title: Animal Breeders

detailed.description: Grade, sort, or classify unprocessed food and other agricultural products by size, weight, color, or condition.
detailed.title: Graders and Sorters, Agricultural Products

detailed.description: Drive and control farm equipment to till soil and to plant, cultivate, and harvest crops. May perform tasks, such as crop baling or hay bucking. May operate stationary equipment to perform post-harvest tasks, such as husking, shelling, threshing, and ginning.
detailed.title: Agricultural Equipment Operators

detailed.description: Manually plant, cultivate, and harvest vegetables, fruits, nuts, horticultural specialties, and field crops. Use hand tools, such as shovels, trowels, hoes, tampers, pruning hooks, shears, and knives. Duties may include tilling soil and applying fertilizers; transplanting, weeding, thinning, or pruning crops; applying pesticides; or cleaning, grading, sorting, packing, and loading harvested products. May construct trellises, repair fences and farm buildings, or participate in irrigation activities.
detailed.title: Farmworkers and Laborers, Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse

detailed.description: Attend to live farm, ranch, or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, finfish, shellfish, and bees. Attend to animals produced for animal products, such as meat, fur, skins, feathers, eggs, milk, and honey. Duties may include feeding, watering, herding, grazing, castrating, branding, de-beaking, weighing, catching, and loading animals. May maintain records on animals; examine animals to detect diseases and injuries; assist in birth deliveries; and administer medications, vaccinations, or insecticides as appropriate. May clean and maintain animal housing areas. Includes workers who shear wool from sheep, and collect eggs in hatcheries.
detailed.title: Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals

detailed.description: All agricultural workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Agricultural Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Use nets, fishing rods, traps, or other equipment to catch and gather fish or other aquatic animals from rivers, lakes, or oceans, for human consumption or other uses. May haul game onto ship.
detailed.title: Fishers and Related Fishing Workers

detailed.description: Hunt and trap wild animals for human consumption, fur, feed, bait, or other purposes.
detailed.title: Hunters and Trappers

detailed.description: Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, and tree planters.
detailed.title: Forest and Conservation Workers

detailed.description: Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.
detailed.title: Fallers

detailed.description: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush.
detailed.title: Logging Equipment Operators

detailed.description: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
detailed.title: Log Graders and Scalers

detailed.description: All logging workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Logging Workers, All Other

minor.title: Supervisors of Construction and Extraction Workers

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers

detailed.description: Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.
detailed.title: Boilermakers

detailed.description: Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures.
detailed.title: Brickmasons and Blockmasons

detailed.description: Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.
detailed.title: Stonemasons

detailed.description: Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. May also install cabinets, siding, drywall and batt or roll insulation. Includes brattice builders who build doors or brattices (ventilation walls or partitions) in underground passageways.
detailed.title: Carpenters

broad.title: Carpet, Floor, and Tile Installers and Finishers

detailed.description: Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials.
detailed.title: Carpet Installers

detailed.description: Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.
detailed.title: Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles

detailed.description: Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.
detailed.title: Floor Sanders and Finishers

detailed.description: Apply hard tile, marble, and wood tile to walls, floors, ceilings, and roof decks.
detailed.title: Tile and Marble Setters

broad.title: Cement Masons, Concrete Finishers, and Terrazzo Workers

detailed.description: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints.
detailed.title: Cement Masons and Concrete Finishers

detailed.description: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.
detailed.title: Terrazzo Workers and Finishers

detailed.description: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers.
detailed.title: Construction Laborers

detailed.description: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways, or equipment used for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.
detailed.title: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators

detailed.description: Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures, such as buildings, bridges, and piers.
detailed.title: Pile-Driver Operators

detailed.description: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.
detailed.title: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators

broad.title: Drywall Installers, Ceiling Tile Installers, and Tapers

detailed.description: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fire-proofing, or acoustical material.
detailed.title: Drywall and Ceiling Tile Installers

detailed.description: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.
detailed.title: Tapers

detailed.description: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.
detailed.title: Electricians

detailed.description: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.
detailed.title: Glaziers

detailed.description: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
detailed.title: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall

detailed.description: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
detailed.title: Insulation Workers, Mechanical

detailed.description: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency.
detailed.title: Painters, Construction and Maintenance

detailed.description: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.
detailed.title: Paperhangers

detailed.description: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints.
detailed.title: Pipelayers

detailed.description: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinklerfitters.
detailed.title: Plumbers, Pipefitters, and Steamfitters

detailed.description: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.
detailed.title: Plasterers and Stucco Masons

detailed.description: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.
detailed.title: Reinforcing Iron and Rebar Workers

detailed.description: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.
detailed.title: Roofers

detailed.description: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.
detailed.title: Sheet Metal Workers

detailed.description: Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings.
detailed.title: Structural Iron and Steel Workers

detailed.description: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks.
detailed.title: Solar Photovoltaic Installers

detailed.description: Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Brickmasons, Blockmasons, Stonemasons, and Tile and Marble Setters

detailed.description: Help carpenters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Carpenters

detailed.description: Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Electricians

detailed.description: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Painters, Paperhangers, Plasterers, and Stucco Masons

detailed.description: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Pipelayers, Plumbers, Pipefitters, and Steamfitters

detailed.description: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Roofers

detailed.description: All construction trades helpers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Helpers, Construction Trades, All Other

detailed.description: Inspect structures using engineering skills to determine structural soundness and compliance with specifications, building codes, and other regulations. Inspections may be general in nature or may be limited to a specific area, such as electrical systems or plumbing.
detailed.title: Construction and Building Inspectors

detailed.description: Assemble, install, repair, or maintain electric or hydraulic freight or passenger elevators, escalators, or dumbwaiters.
detailed.title: Elevator Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Erect and repair fences and fence gates, using hand and power tools.
detailed.title: Fence Erectors

detailed.description: Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. Specialized training and certification in hazardous materials handling or a confined entry permit are generally required. May operate earth-moving equipment or trucks.
detailed.title: Hazardous Materials Removal Workers

detailed.description: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement, repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road or plow snow from roadway.
detailed.title: Highway Maintenance Workers

broad.title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators

detailed.description: Lay, repair, and maintain track for standard or narrow-gauge railroad equipment used in regular railroad service or in plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. Includes ballast cleaning machine operators and railroad bed tamping machine operators.
detailed.title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators

broad.title: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners

detailed.description: Clean and repair septic tanks, sewer lines, or drains. May patch walls and partitions of tank, replace damaged drain tile, or repair breaks in underground piping.
detailed.title: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners

detailed.description: Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.
detailed.title: Segmental Pavers

detailed.description: All construction and related workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Construction and Related Workers, All Other

broad.title: Derrick, Rotary Drill, and Service Unit Operators, Oil, Gas, and Mining

detailed.description: Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud through drill hole.
detailed.title: Derrick Operators, Oil and Gas

detailed.description: Set up or operate a variety of drills to remove underground oil and gas, or remove core samples for testing during oil and gas exploration.
detailed.title: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas

detailed.description: Operate equipment to increase oil flow from producing wells or to remove stuck pipe, casing, tools, or other obstructions from drilling wells. May also perform similar services in mining exploration operations. Includes fishing-tool technicians.
detailed.title: Service Unit Operators, Oil, Gas, and Mining

broad.title: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas

detailed.description: Operate a variety of drills such as rotary, churn, and pneumatic to tap sub-surface water and salt deposits, to remove core samples during mineral exploration or soil testing, and to facilitate the use of explosives in mining or construction. May use explosives. Includes horizontal and earth boring machine operators.
detailed.title: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas

broad.title: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters

detailed.description: Place and detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials. May perform specialized handling, storage, and accounting procedures. Includes seismograph shooters.
detailed.title: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters

detailed.description: Operate self-propelled mining machines that rip coal, metal and nonmetal ores, rock, stone, or sand from the mine face and load it onto conveyors or into shuttle cars in a continuous operation.
detailed.title: Continuous Mining Machine Operators

detailed.description: Operate machinery such as longwall shears, plows, and cutting machines to cut or channel along the face or seams of coal mines, stone quarries, or other mining surfaces to facilitate blasting, separating, or removing minerals or materials from mines or from the Earth's surface. Includes shale planers.
detailed.title: Mine Cutting and Channeling Machine Operators

detailed.description: All mining machine operators not listed separately.
detailed.title: Mining Machine Operators, All Other

detailed.description: Separate blocks of rough dimension stone from quarry mass using jackhammer and wedges.
detailed.title: Rock Splitters, Quarry

detailed.description: Operate machinery to install roof support bolts in underground mine.
detailed.title: Roof Bolters, Mining

detailed.description: Assemble or repair oil field equipment using hand and power tools. Perform other tasks as needed.
detailed.title: Roustabouts, Oil and Gas

detailed.description: Help extraction craft workers, such as earth drillers, blasters and explosives workers, derrick operators, and mining machine operators, by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying equipment or cleaning work area.
detailed.title: Helpers--Extraction Workers

detailed.description: All extraction workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Extraction Workers, All Other

minor.title: Supervisors of Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Workers

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of mechanics, installers, and repairers.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

minor.title: Electrical and Electronic Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

broad.title: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers

detailed.description: Repair, maintain, or install computers, word processing systems, automated teller machines, and electronic office machines, such as duplicating and fax machines.
detailed.title: Computer, Automated Teller, and Office Machine Repairers

broad.title: Radio and Telecommunications Equipment Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Repair, install or maintain mobile or stationary radio transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment, and two-way radio communications systems used in cellular telecommunications, mobile broadband, ship-to-shore, aircraft-to-ground communications, and radio equipment in service and emergency vehicles. May test and analyze network coverage.
detailed.title: Radio, Cellular, and Tower Equipment Installers and Repairs

detailed.description: Install, set-up, rearrange, or remove switching, distribution, routing, and dialing equipment used in central offices or headends. Service or repair telephone, cable television, Internet, and other communications equipment on customers' property. May install communications equipment or communications wiring in buildings.
detailed.title: Telecommunications Equipment Installers and Repairers, Except Line Installers

broad.title: Miscellaneous Electrical and Electronic Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

detailed.description: Install, inspect, test, adjust, or repair avionics equipment, such as radar, radio, navigation, and missile control systems in aircraft or space vehicles.
detailed.title: Avionics Technicians

detailed.description: Repair, maintain, or install electric motors, wiring, or switches.
detailed.title: Electric Motor, Power Tool, and Related Repairers

detailed.description: Install, adjust, or maintain mobile electronics communication equipment, including sound, sonar, security, navigation, and surveillance systems on trains, watercraft, or other mobile equipment.
detailed.title: Electrical and Electronics Installers and Repairers, Transportation Equipment

detailed.description: Repair, test, adjust, or install electronic equipment, such as industrial controls, transmitters, and antennas.
detailed.title: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Commercial and Industrial Equipment

detailed.description: Inspect, test, repair, or maintain electrical equipment in generating stations, substations, and in-service relays.
detailed.title: Electrical and Electronics Repairers, Powerhouse, Substation, and Relay

detailed.description: Install, diagnose, or repair communications, sound, security, or navigation equipment in motor vehicles.
detailed.title: Electronic Equipment Installers and Repairers, Motor Vehicles

detailed.description: Repair, adjust, or install audio or television receivers, stereo systems, camcorders, video systems, or other electronic home entertainment equipment.
detailed.title: Electronic Home Entertainment Equipment Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Install, program, maintain, or repair security or fire alarm wiring and equipment. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes.
detailed.title: Security and Fire Alarm Systems Installers

minor.title: Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul aircraft engines and assemblies, such as hydraulic and pneumatic systems. Includes helicopter and aircraft engine specialists.
detailed.title: Aircraft Mechanics and Service Technicians

detailed.description: Repair and refinish automotive vehicle bodies and straighten vehicle frames.
detailed.title: Automotive Body and Related Repairers

detailed.description: Replace or repair broken windshields and window glass in motor vehicles.
detailed.title: Automotive Glass Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul automotive vehicles.
detailed.title: Automotive Service Technicians and Mechanics

broad.title: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul buses and trucks, or maintain and repair any type of diesel engines. Includes mechanics working primarily with automobile or marine diesel engines.
detailed.title: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists

broad.title: Heavy Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Service Technicians and Mechanics

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul farm machinery and vehicles, such as tractors, harvesters, dairy equipment, and irrigation systems.
detailed.title: Farm Equipment Mechanics and Service Technicians

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment, such as cranes, bulldozers, graders, and conveyors, used in construction, logging, and surface mining.
detailed.title: Mobile Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Except Engines

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul railroad rolling stock, mine cars, or mass transit rail cars.
detailed.title: Rail Car Repairers

detailed.description: Repair and adjust electrical and mechanical equipment of inboard or inboard-outboard boat engines.
detailed.title: Motorboat Mechanics and Service Technicians

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul motorcycles, scooters, mopeds, dirt bikes, or similar motorized vehicles.
detailed.title: Motorcycle Mechanics

detailed.description: Diagnose, adjust, repair, or overhaul small engines used to power lawn mowers, chain saws, recreational sporting equipment and related equipment.
detailed.title: Outdoor Power Equipment and Other Small Engine Mechanics

broad.title: Miscellaneous Vehicle and Mobile Equipment Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers

detailed.description: Repair and service bicycles.
detailed.title: Bicycle Repairers

detailed.description: Diagnose, inspect, adjust, repair, or overhaul recreational vehicles including travel trailers. May specialize in maintaining gas, electrical, hydraulic, plumbing, or chassis/towing systems as well as repairing generators, appliances, and interior components. Includes workers who perform customized van conversions.
detailed.title: Recreational Vehicle Service Technicians

detailed.description: Repair and replace tires.
detailed.title: Tire Repairers and Changers

minor.title: Other Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Occupations

broad.title: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Install, service, or repair automatic door mechanisms and hydraulic doors. Includes garage door mechanics.
detailed.title: Mechanical Door Repairers

detailed.description: Install, repair, and maintain mechanical regulating and controlling devices, such as electric meters, gas regulators, thermostats, safety and flow valves, and other mechanical governors.
detailed.title: Control and Valve Installers and Repairers, Except Mechanical Door

broad.title: Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics and Installers

detailed.description: Install or repair heating, central air conditioning, or refrigeration systems, including oil burners, hot-air furnaces, and heating stoves.
detailed.title: Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics and Installers

detailed.description: Repair, adjust, or install all types of electric or gas household appliances, such as refrigerators, washers, dryers, and ovens.
detailed.title: Home Appliance Repairers

broad.title: Industrial Machinery Installation, Repair, and Maintenance Workers

detailed.description: Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems.
detailed.title: Industrial Machinery Mechanics

detailed.description: Lubricate machinery, change parts, or perform other routine machinery maintenance.
detailed.title: Maintenance Workers, Machinery

detailed.description: Install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, or other drawings.
detailed.title: Millwrights

detailed.description: Build or repair equipment such as furnaces, kilns, cupolas, boilers, converters, ladles, soaking pits and ovens, using refractory materials.
detailed.title: Refractory Materials Repairers, Except Brickmasons

detailed.description: Install or repair cables or wires used in electrical power or distribution systems. May erect poles and light or heavy duty transmission towers.
detailed.title: Electrical Power-Line Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Install and repair telecommunications cable, including fiber optics.
detailed.title: Telecommunications Line Installers and Repairers

detailed.description: Repair and adjust cameras and photographic equipment, including commercial video and motion picture camera equipment.
detailed.title: Camera and Photographic Equipment Repairers

detailed.description: Test, adjust, or repair biomedical or electromedical equipment.
detailed.title: Medical Equipment Repairers

detailed.description: Repair percussion, stringed, reed, or wind instruments. May specialize in one area, such as piano tuning.
detailed.title: Musical Instrument Repairers and Tuners

detailed.description: Repair, clean, and adjust mechanisms of timing instruments, such as watches and clocks. Includes watchmakers, watch technicians, and mechanical timepiece repairers.
detailed.title: Watch Repairers

detailed.description: All precision instrument and equipment repairers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Precision Instrument and Equipment Repairers, All Other

detailed.description: Perform work involving the skills of two or more maintenance or craft occupations to keep machines, mechanical equipment, or the structure of an establishment in repair. Duties may involve pipe fitting; boiler making; insulating; welding; machining; carpentry; repairing electrical or mechanical equipment; installing, aligning, and balancing new equipment; and repairing buildings, floors, or stairs.
detailed.title: Maintenance and Repair Workers, General

detailed.description: Inspect, diagnose, adjust, or repair wind turbines. Perform maintenance on wind turbine equipment including resolving electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic malfunctions.
detailed.title: Wind Turbine Service Technicians

broad.title: Miscellaneous Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Workers

detailed.description: Install, service, adjust, or repair coin, vending, or amusement machines including video games, juke boxes, pinball machines, or slot machines.
detailed.title: Coin, Vending, and Amusement Machine Servicers and Repairers

detailed.description: Work below surface of water, using scuba gear to inspect, repair, remove, or install equipment and structures. May use a variety of power and hand tools, such as drills, sledgehammers, torches, and welding equipment. May conduct tests or experiments, rig explosives, or photograph structures or marine life.
detailed.title: Commercial Divers

detailed.description: Repair tears, holes, and other defects in fabrics, such as draperies, linens, parachutes, and tents.
detailed.title: Fabric Menders, Except Garment

detailed.description: Repair and open locks; make keys; change locks and safe combinations; and install and repair safes.
detailed.title: Locksmiths and Safe Repairers

detailed.description: Move or install mobile homes or prefabricated buildings.
detailed.title: Manufactured Building and Mobile Home Installers

detailed.description: Set up or repair rigging for construction projects, manufacturing plants, logging yards, ships and shipyards, or for the entertainment industry.
detailed.title: Riggers

detailed.description: Install, inspect, test, maintain, or repair electric gate crossings, signals, signal equipment, track switches, section lines, or intercommunications systems within a railroad system.
detailed.title: Signal and Track Switch Repairers

detailed.description: Help installation, maintenance, and repair workers in maintenance, parts replacement, and repair of vehicles, industrial machinery, and electrical and electronic equipment. Perform duties such as furnishing tools, materials, and supplies to other workers; cleaning work area, machines, and tools; and holding materials or tools for other workers.
detailed.title: Helpers--Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Workers

detailed.description: All installation, maintenance, and repair workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Installation, Maintenance, and Repair Workers, All Other

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Production and Operating Workers

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Production and Operating Workers

broad.title: Aircraft Structure, Surfaces, Rigging, and Systems Assemblers

detailed.description: Assemble, fit, fasten, and install parts of airplanes, space vehicles, or missiles, such as tails, wings, fuselage, bulkheads, stabilizers, landing gear, rigging and control equipment, or heating and ventilating systems.
detailed.title: Aircraft Structure, Surfaces, Rigging, and Systems Assemblers

detailed.description: Wind wire coils used in electrical components, such as resistors and transformers, and in electrical equipment and instruments, such as field cores, bobbins, armature cores, electrical motors, generators, and control equipment.
detailed.title: Coil Winders, Tapers, and Finishers

detailed.description: Assemble or modify electrical or electronic equipment, such as computers, test equipment telemetering systems, electric motors, and batteries.
detailed.title: Electrical and Electronic Equipment Assemblers

detailed.description: Assemble or modify electromechanical equipment or devices, such as servomechanisms, gyros, dynamometers, magnetic drums, tape drives, brakes, control linkage, actuators, and appliances.
detailed.title: Electromechanical Equipment Assemblers

detailed.description: Construct, assemble, or rebuild machines, such as engines, turbines, and similar equipment used in such industries as construction, extraction, textiles, and paper manufacturing.
detailed.title: Engine and Other Machine Assemblers

detailed.description: Fabricate, position, align, and fit parts of structural metal products.
detailed.title: Structural Metal Fabricators and Fitters

detailed.description: Laminate layers of fiberglass on molds to form boat decks and hulls, bodies for golf carts, automobiles, or other products.
detailed.title: Fiberglass Laminators and Fabricators

detailed.description: Work as part of a team having responsibility for assembling an entire product or component of a product. Team assemblers can perform all tasks conducted by the team in the assembly process and rotate through all or most of them rather than being assigned to a specific task on a permanent basis. May participate in making management decisions affecting the work. Includes team leaders who work as part of the team.
detailed.title: Team Assemblers

detailed.description: Perform precision assembling, adjusting, or calibrating, within narrow tolerances, of timing devices such as digital clocks or timing devices with electrical or electronic components.
detailed.title: Timing Device Assemblers and Adjusters

detailed.description: All assemblers and fabricators not listed separately.
detailed.title: Assemblers and Fabricators, All Other

detailed.description: Mix and bake ingredients to produce breads, rolls, cookies, cakes, pies, pastries, or other baked goods.
detailed.title: Bakers

broad.title: Butchers and Other Meat, Poultry, and Fish Processing Workers

detailed.description: Cut, trim, or prepare consumer-sized portions of meat for use or sale in retail establishments.
detailed.title: Butchers and Meat Cutters

detailed.description: Use hand or hand tools to perform routine cutting and trimming of meat, poultry, and seafood.
detailed.title: Meat, Poultry, and Fish Cutters and Trimmers

detailed.description: Work in slaughtering, meat packing, or wholesale establishments performing precision functions involving the preparation of meat. Work may include specialized slaughtering tasks, cutting standard or premium cuts of meat for marketing, making sausage, or wrapping meats.
detailed.title: Slaughterers and Meat Packers

detailed.description: Operate or tend food or tobacco roasting, baking, or drying equipment, including hearth ovens, kiln driers, roasters, char kilns, and vacuum drying equipment.
detailed.title: Food and Tobacco Roasting, Baking, and Drying Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up and operate equipment that mixes or blends ingredients used in the manufacturing of food products. Includes candy makers and cheese makers.
detailed.title: Food Batchmakers

detailed.description: Operate or tend cooking equipment, such as steam cooking vats, deep fry cookers, pressure cookers, kettles, and boilers, to prepare food products.
detailed.title: Food Cooking Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: All food processing workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Food Processing Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Operate computer-controlled machines or robots to perform one or more machine functions on metal or plastic work pieces.
detailed.title: Computer-Controlled Machine Tool Operators, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Develop programs to control machining or processing of metal or plastic parts by automatic machine tools, equipment, or systems.
detailed.title: Computer Numerically Controlled Machine Tool Programmers, Metal and Plastic

broad.title: Forming Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to extrude or draw thermoplastic or metal materials into tubes, rods, hoses, wire, bars, or structural shapes.
detailed.title: Extruding and Drawing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend forging machines to taper, shape, or form metal or plastic parts.
detailed.title: Forging Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to roll steel or plastic forming bends, beads, knurls, rolls, or plate or to flatten, temper, or reduce gauge of material.
detailed.title: Rolling Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

broad.title: Machine Tool Cutting Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to saw, cut, shear, slit, punch, crimp, notch, bend, or straighten metal or plastic material.
detailed.title: Cutting, Punching, and Press Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend drilling machines to drill, bore, ream, mill, or countersink metal or plastic work pieces.
detailed.title: Drilling and Boring Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend grinding and related tools that remove excess material or burrs from surfaces, sharpen edges or corners, or buff, hone, or polish metal or plastic work pieces.
detailed.title: Grinding, Lapping, Polishing, and Buffing Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend lathe and turning machines to turn, bore, thread, form, or face metal or plastic materials, such as wire, rod, or bar stock.
detailed.title: Lathe and Turning Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend milling or planing machines to mill, plane, shape, groove, or profile metal or plastic work pieces.
detailed.title: Milling and Planing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts and instruments. Includes precision instrument makers who fabricate, modify, or repair mechanical instruments. May also fabricate and modify parts to make or repair machine tools or maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of mechanics, mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures.
detailed.title: Machinists

broad.title: Metal Furnace Operators, Tenders, Pourers, and Casters

detailed.description: Operate or tend furnaces, such as gas, oil, coal, electric-arc or electric induction, open-hearth, or oxygen furnaces, to melt and refine metal before casting or to produce specified types of steel.
detailed.title: Metal-Refining Furnace Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate hand-controlled mechanisms to pour and regulate the flow of molten metal into molds to produce castings or ingots.
detailed.title: Pourers and Casters, Metal

broad.title: Model Makers and Patternmakers, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up and operate machines, such as lathes, milling and engraving machines, and jig borers to make working models of metal or plastic objects. Includes template makers.
detailed.title: Model Makers, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Lay out, machine, fit, and assemble castings and parts to metal or plastic foundry patterns, core boxes, or match plates.
detailed.title: Patternmakers, Metal and Plastic

broad.title: Molders and Molding Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Make or form wax or sand cores or molds used in the production of metal castings in foundries.
detailed.title: Foundry Mold and Coremakers

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend metal or plastic molding, casting, or coremaking machines to mold or cast metal or thermoplastic parts or products.
detailed.title: Molding, Coremaking, and Casting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

broad.title: Multiple Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend more than one type of cutting or forming machine tool or robot.
detailed.title: Multiple Machine Tool Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Analyze specifications, lay out metal stock, set up and operate machine tools, and fit and assemble parts to make and repair dies, cutting tools, jigs, fixtures, gauges, and machinists' hand tools.
detailed.title: Tool and Die Makers

detailed.description: Use hand-welding, flame-cutting, hand soldering, or brazing equipment to weld or join metal components or to fill holes, indentations, or seams of fabricated metal products.
detailed.title: Welders, Cutters, Solderers, and Brazers

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend welding, soldering, or brazing machines or robots that weld, braze, solder, or heat treat metal products, components, or assemblies. Includes workers who operate laser cutters or laser-beam machines.
detailed.title: Welding, Soldering, and Brazing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

broad.title: Miscellaneous Metal Workers and Plastic Workers

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend heating equipment, such as heat-treating furnaces, flame-hardening machines, induction machines, soaking pits, or vacuum equipment to temper, harden, anneal, or heat-treat metal or plastic objects.
detailed.title: Heat Treating Equipment Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Lay out reference points and dimensions on metal or plastic stock or workpieces, such as sheets, plates, tubes, structural shapes, castings, or machine parts, for further processing. Includes shipfitters.
detailed.title: Layout Workers, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend plating or coating machines to coat metal or plastic products with chromium, zinc, copper, cadmium, nickel, or other metal to protect or decorate surfaces. Includes electrolytic processes.
detailed.title: Plating and Coating Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Perform precision smoothing, sharpening, polishing, or grinding of metal objects.
detailed.title: Tool Grinders, Filers, and Sharpeners

detailed.description: All metal workers and plastic workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Metal Workers and Plastic Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Format and proof text and images submitted by designers and clients into finished pages that can be printed. Includes digital and photo typesetting. May produce printing plates.
detailed.title: Prepress Technicians and Workers

detailed.description: Set up and operate digital, letterpress, lithographic, flexographic, gravure, or other printing machines. Includes short-run offset printing presses.
detailed.title: Printing Press Operators

detailed.description: Bind books and other publications or finish printed products by hand or machine. May set up binding and finishing machines.
detailed.title: Print Binding and Finishing Workers

detailed.description: Operate or tend washing or dry-cleaning machines to wash or dry-clean industrial or household articles, such as cloth garments, suede, leather, furs, blankets, draperies, linens, rugs, and carpets. Includes spotters and dyers of these articles.
detailed.title: Laundry and Dry-Cleaning Workers

broad.title: Pressers, Textile, Garment, and Related Materials

detailed.description: Press or shape articles by hand or machine.
detailed.title: Pressers, Textile, Garment, and Related Materials

detailed.description: Operate or tend sewing machines to join, reinforce, decorate, or perform related sewing operations in the manufacture of garment or nongarment products.
detailed.title: Sewing Machine Operators

detailed.description: Construct, decorate, or repair leather and leather-like products, such as luggage, shoes, and saddles.
detailed.title: Shoe and Leather Workers and Repairers

detailed.description: Operate or tend a variety of machines to join, decorate, reinforce, or finish shoes and shoe parts.
detailed.title: Shoe Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Sew, join, reinforce, or finish, usually with needle and thread, a variety of manufactured items. Includes weavers and stitchers.
detailed.title: Sewers, Hand

detailed.description: Design, make, alter, repair, or fit garments.
detailed.title: Tailors, Dressmakers, and Custom Sewers

broad.title: Textile Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend machines to bleach, shrink, wash, dye, or finish textiles or synthetic or glass fibers.
detailed.title: Textile Bleaching and Dyeing Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut textiles.
detailed.title: Textile Cutting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines that knit, loop, weave, or draw in textiles.
detailed.title: Textile Knitting and Weaving Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines that wind or twist textiles; or draw out and combine sliver, such as wool, hemp, or synthetic fibers. Includes slubber machine and drawing frame operators.
detailed.title: Textile Winding, Twisting, and Drawing Out Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

broad.title: Miscellaneous Textile, Apparel, and Furnishings Workers

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines that extrude and form continuous filaments from synthetic materials, such as liquid polymer, rayon, and fiberglass.
detailed.title: Extruding and Forming Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Synthetic and Glass Fibers

detailed.description: Draw and construct sets of precision master fabric patterns or layouts. May also mark and cut fabrics and apparel.
detailed.title: Fabric and Apparel Patternmakers

detailed.description: Make, repair, or replace upholstery for household furniture or transportation vehicles.
detailed.title: Upholsterers

detailed.description: All textile, apparel, and furnishings workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Textile, Apparel, and Furnishings Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Cut, shape, and assemble wooden articles or set up and operate a variety of woodworking machines, such as power saws, jointers, and mortisers to surface, cut, or shape lumber or to fabricate parts for wood products.
detailed.title: Cabinetmakers and Bench Carpenters

detailed.description: Shape, finish, and refinish damaged, worn, or used furniture or new high-grade furniture to specified color or finish.
detailed.title: Furniture Finishers

detailed.description: Construct full-size and scale wooden precision models of products. Includes wood jig builders and loft workers.
detailed.title: Model Makers, Wood

detailed.description: Plan, lay out, and construct wooden unit or sectional patterns used in forming sand molds for castings.
detailed.title: Patternmakers, Wood

broad.title: Woodworking Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend wood sawing machines. May operate CNC equipment. Includes lead sawyers.
detailed.title: Sawing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Wood

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend woodworking machines, such as drill presses, lathes, shapers, routers, sanders, planers, and wood nailing machines. May operate CNC equipment.
detailed.title: Woodworking Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders, Except Sawing

detailed.description: All woodworkers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Woodworkers, All Other

broad.title: Power Plant Operators, Distributors, and Dispatchers

detailed.description: Operate or control nuclear reactors. Move control rods, start and stop equipment, monitor and adjust controls, and record data in logs. Implement emergency procedures when needed. May respond to abnormalities, determine cause, and recommend corrective action.
detailed.title: Nuclear Power Reactor Operators

detailed.description: Coordinate, regulate, or distribute electricity or steam.
detailed.title: Power Distributors and Dispatchers

detailed.description: Control, operate, or maintain machinery to generate electric power. Includes auxiliary equipment operators.
detailed.title: Power Plant Operators

detailed.description: Operate or maintain stationary engines, boilers, or other mechanical equipment to provide utilities for buildings or industrial processes. Operate equipment, such as steam engines, generators, motors, turbines, and steam boilers.
detailed.title: Stationary Engineers and Boiler Operators

broad.title: Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant and System Operators

detailed.description: Operate or control an entire process or system of machines, often through the use of control boards, to transfer or treat water or wastewater.
detailed.title: Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant and System Operators

detailed.description: Control or operate entire chemical processes or system of machines.
detailed.title: Chemical Plant and System Operators

detailed.description: Distribute or process gas for utility companies and others by controlling compressors to maintain specified pressures on main pipelines.
detailed.title: Gas Plant Operators

detailed.description: Operate or control petroleum refining or processing units. May specialize in controlling manifold and pumping systems, gauging or testing oil in storage tanks, or regulating the flow of oil into pipelines.
detailed.title: Petroleum Pump System Operators, Refinery Operators, and Gaugers

detailed.description: All plant and system operators not listed separately.
detailed.title: Plant and System Operators, All Other

broad.title: Chemical Processing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend equipment to control chemical changes or reactions in the processing of industrial or consumer products. Equipment used includes devulcanizers, steam-jacketed kettles, and reactor vessels.
detailed.title: Chemical Equipment Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend continuous flow or vat-type equipment; filter presses; shaker screens; centrifuges; condenser tubes; precipitating, fermenting, or evaporating tanks; scrubbing towers; or batch stills. These machines extract, sort, or separate liquids, gases, or solids from other materials to recover a refined product. Includes dairy processing equipment operators.
detailed.title: Separating, Filtering, Clarifying, Precipitating, and Still Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

broad.title: Crushing, Grinding, Polishing, Mixing, and Blending Workers

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to crush, grind, or polish materials, such as coal, glass, grain, stone, food, or rubber.
detailed.title: Crushing, Grinding, and Polishing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Grind, sand, or polish, using hand tools or hand-held power tools, a variety of metal, wood, stone, clay, plastic, or glass objects. Includes chippers, buffers, and finishers.
detailed.title: Grinding and Polishing Workers, Hand

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to mix or blend materials, such as chemicals, tobacco, liquids, color pigments, or explosive ingredients.
detailed.title: Mixing and Blending Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Use hand tools or hand-held power tools to cut and trim a variety of manufactured items, such as carpet, fabric, stone, glass, or rubber.
detailed.title: Cutters and Trimmers, Hand

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines that cut or slice materials, such as glass, stone, cork, rubber, tobacco, food, paper, or insulating material.
detailed.title: Cutting and Slicing Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

broad.title: Extruding, Forming, Pressing, and Compacting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines, such as glass forming machines, plodder machines, and tuber machines, to shape and form products, such as glassware, food, rubber, soap, brick, tile, clay, wax, tobacco, or cosmetics.
detailed.title: Extruding, Forming, Pressing, and Compacting Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

broad.title: Furnace, Kiln, Oven, Drier, and Kettle Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend heating equipment other than basic metal, plastic, or food processing equipment. Includes activities, such as annealing glass, drying lumber, curing rubber, removing moisture from materials, or boiling soap.
detailed.title: Furnace, Kiln, Oven, Drier, and Kettle Operators and Tenders

broad.title: Inspectors, Testers, Sorters, Samplers, and Weighers

detailed.description: Inspect, test, sort, sample, or weigh nonagricultural raw materials or processed, machined, fabricated, or assembled parts or products for defects, wear, and deviations from specifications. May use precision measuring instruments and complex test equipment.
detailed.title: Inspectors, Testers, Sorters, Samplers, and Weighers

broad.title: Jewelers and Precious Stone and Metal Workers

detailed.description: Design, fabricate, adjust, repair, or appraise jewelry, gold, silver, other precious metals, or gems. Includes diamond polishers and gem cutters, and persons who perform precision casting and modeling of molds, casting metal in molds, or setting precious and semi-precious stones for jewelry and related products.
detailed.title: Jewelers and Precious Stone and Metal Workers

broad.title: Medical, Dental, and Ophthalmic Laboratory Technicians

detailed.description: Construct and repair full or partial dentures or dental appliances.
detailed.title: Dental Laboratory Technicians

detailed.description: Construct, fit, maintain, or repair medical supportive devices, such as braces, orthotics and prosthetic devices, joints, arch supports, and other surgical and medical appliances.
detailed.title: Medical Appliance Technicians

detailed.description: Cut, grind, and polish eyeglasses, contact lenses, or other precision optical elements. Assemble and mount lenses into frames or process other optical elements. Includes precision lens polishers or grinders, centerer-edgers, and lens mounters.
detailed.title: Ophthalmic Laboratory Technicians

broad.title: Packaging and Filling Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend machines to prepare industrial or consumer products for storage or shipment. Includes cannery workers who pack food products.
detailed.title: Packaging and Filling Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend machines to coat or paint any of a wide variety of products, including glassware, cloth, ceramics, metal, plastic, paper, or wood, with lacquer, silver, copper, rubber, varnish, glaze, enamel, oil, or rust-proofing materials.
detailed.title: Coating, Painting, and Spraying Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend painting machines to paint surfaces of transportation equipment, such as automobiles, buses, trucks, trains, boats, and airplanes. Includes painters in auto body repair facilities.
detailed.title: Painters, Transportation Equipment

detailed.description: Paint, coat, or decorate articles such as furniture, glass, plateware, pottery, jewelry, toys, books, or leather.
detailed.title: Painting, Coating, and Decorating Workers

detailed.description: Perform any or all of the following functions in the manufacture of electronic semiconductors: load semiconductor material into furnace; saw formed ingots into segments; load individual segment into crystal growing chamber and monitor controls; locate crystal axis in ingot using x-ray equipment and saw ingots into wafers; and clean, polish, and load wafers into series of special purpose furnaces, chemical baths, and equipment used to form circuitry and change conductive properties.
detailed.title: Semiconductor Processors

broad.title: Photographic Process Workers and Processing Machine Operators

detailed.description: Perform work involved in developing and processing photographic images from film or digital media. May perform precision tasks such as editing photographic negatives and prints.
detailed.title: Photographic Process Workers and Processing Machine Operators

detailed.description: Operate or tend bonding machines that use adhesives to join items for further processing or to form a completed product. Processes include joining veneer sheets into plywood; gluing paper; or joining rubber and rubberized fabric parts, plastic, simulated leather, or other materials.
detailed.title: Adhesive Bonding Machine Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend machines to wash or clean products, such as barrels or kegs, glass items, tin plate, food, pulp, coal, plastic, or rubber, to remove impurities.
detailed.title: Cleaning, Washing, and Metal Pickling Equipment Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate or tend equipment, such as cooling and freezing units, refrigerators, batch freezers, and freezing tunnels, to cool or freeze products, food, blood plasma, and chemicals.
detailed.title: Cooling and Freezing Equipment Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Engrave or etch metal, wood, rubber, or other materials. Includes such workers as etcher-circuit processors, pantograph engravers, and silk screen etchers.
detailed.title: Etchers and Engravers

detailed.description: Mold, shape, form, cast, or carve products such as food products, figurines, tile, pipes, and candles consisting of clay, glass, plaster, concrete, stone, or combinations of materials.
detailed.title: Molders, Shapers, and Casters, Except Metal and Plastic

detailed.description: Set up, operate, or tend paper goods machines that perform a variety of functions, such as converting, sawing, corrugating, banding, wrapping, boxing, stitching, forming, or sealing paper or paperboard sheets into products.
detailed.title: Paper Goods Machine Setters, Operators, and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate machines to build tires.
detailed.title: Tire Builders

detailed.description: Help production workers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include supplying or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
detailed.title: Helpers--Production Workers

detailed.description: All production workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Production Workers, All Other

minor.title: Supervisors of Transportation and Material Moving Workers

detailed.description: Supervise and coordinate the activities of ground crew in the loading, unloading, securing, and staging of aircraft cargo or baggage. May determine the quantity and orientation of cargo and compute aircraft center of gravity. May accompany aircraft as member of flight crew and monitor and handle cargo in flight, and assist and brief passengers on safety and emergency procedures. Includes loadmasters.
detailed.title: Aircraft Cargo Handling Supervisors

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Helpers, Laborers, and Material Movers, Hand

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of helpers, laborers, or material movers.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Helpers, Laborers, and Material Movers, Hand

broad.title: First-Line Supervisors of Transportation and Material-Moving Machine and Vehicle Operators

detailed.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of transportation and material-moving machine and vehicle operators and helpers.
detailed.title: First-Line Supervisors of Transportation and Material-Moving Machine and Vehicle Operators

detailed.description: Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-wing, multi-engine aircraft, usually on scheduled air carrier routes, for the transport of passengers and cargo. Requires Federal Air Transport Pilot certificate and rating for specific aircraft type used. Includes regional, National, and international airline pilots and flight instructors of airline pilots.
detailed.title: Airline Pilots, Copilots, and Flight Engineers

detailed.description: Pilot and navigate the flight of fixed-winged aircraft on nonscheduled air carrier routes, or helicopters. Requires Commercial Pilot certificate. Includes charter pilots with similar certification, and air ambulance and air tour pilots.
detailed.title: Commercial Pilots

broad.title: Air Traffic Controllers and Airfield Operations Specialists

detailed.description: Control air traffic on and within vicinity of airport and movement of air traffic between altitude sectors and control centers according to established procedures and policies. Authorize, regulate, and control commercial airline flights according to government or company regulations to expedite and ensure flight safety.
detailed.title: Air Traffic Controllers

detailed.description: Ensure the safe takeoff and landing of commercial and military aircraft. Duties include coordination between air-traffic control and maintenance personnel; dispatching; using airfield landing and navigational aids; implementing airfield safety procedures; monitoring and maintaining flight records; and applying knowledge of weather information.
detailed.title: Airfield Operations Specialists

detailed.description: Provide personal services to ensure the safety, security, and comfort of airline passengers during flight. Greet passengers, verify tickets, explain use of safety equipment, and serve food or beverages.
detailed.title: Flight Attendants

broad.title: Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians

detailed.description: Drive ambulance or assist ambulance driver in transporting sick, injured, or convalescent persons. Assist in lifting patients.
detailed.title: Ambulance Drivers and Attendants, Except Emergency Medical Technicians

detailed.description: Drive bus or motor coach, including regular route operations, charters, and private carriage. May assist passengers with baggage. May collect fares or tickets.
detailed.title: Bus Drivers, Transit and Intercity

detailed.description: Transport students or special clients, such as the elderly or persons with disabilities. Ensure adherence to safety rules. May assist passengers in boarding or exiting.
detailed.title: Bus Drivers, School or Special Client

detailed.description: Drive truck or other vehicle over established routes or within an established territory and sell or deliver goods, such as food products, including restaurant take-out items, or pick up or deliver items such as commercial laundry. May also take orders, collect payment, or stock merchandise at point of delivery. Includes newspaper delivery drivers.
detailed.title: Driver/Sales Workers

detailed.description: Drive a tractor-trailer combination or a truck with a capacity of at least 26,000 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW). May be required to unload truck. Requires commercial drivers' license.
detailed.title: Heavy and Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers

detailed.description: Drive a light vehicle, such as a truck or van, with a capacity of less than 26,000 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW), primarily to deliver or pick up merchandise or to deliver packages. May load and unload vehicle.
detailed.title: Light Truck or Delivery Services Drivers

detailed.description: Drive automobiles, vans, or limousines to transport passengers. May occasionally carry cargo. Includes hearse drivers.
detailed.title: Taxi Drivers and Chauffeurs

detailed.description: All motor vehicle operators not listed separately.
detailed.title: Motor Vehicle Operators, All Other

detailed.description: Drive electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotives to transport passengers or freight. Interpret train orders, electronic or manual signals, and railroad rules and regulations.
detailed.title: Locomotive Engineers

detailed.description: Monitor locomotive instruments and watch for dragging equipment, obstacles on rights-of-way, and train signals during run. Watch for and relay traffic signals from yard workers to yard engineer in railroad yard.
detailed.title: Locomotive Firers

detailed.description: Drive switching or other locomotive or dinkey engines within railroad yard, industrial plant, quarry, construction project, or similar location.
detailed.title: Rail Yard Engineers, Dinkey Operators, and Hostlers

broad.title: Railroad Brake, Signal, and Switch Operators

detailed.description: Operate railroad track switches. Couple or uncouple rolling stock to make up or break up trains. Signal engineers by hand or flagging. May inspect couplings, air hoses, journal boxes, and hand brakes.
detailed.title: Railroad Brake, Signal, and Switch Operators

detailed.description: Coordinate activities of switch-engine crew within railroad yard, industrial plant, or similar location. Conductors coordinate activities of train crew on passenger or freight trains. Yardmasters review train schedules and switching orders and coordinate activities of workers engaged in railroad traffic operations, such as the makeup or breakup of trains and yard switching.
detailed.title: Railroad Conductors and Yardmasters

detailed.description: Operate subway or elevated suburban trains with no separate locomotive, or electric-powered streetcar, to transport passengers. May handle fares.
detailed.title: Subway and Streetcar Operators

detailed.description: All rail transportation workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Rail Transportation Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Stand watch to look for obstructions in path of vessel, measure water depth, turn wheel on bridge, or use emergency equipment as directed by captain, mate, or pilot. Break out, rig, overhaul, and store cargo-handling gear, stationary rigging, and running gear. Perform a variety of maintenance tasks to preserve the painted surface of the ship and to maintain line and ship equipment. Must hold government-issued certification and tankerman certification when working aboard liquid-carrying vessels. Includes able seamen and ordinary seamen.
detailed.title: Sailors and Marine Oilers

broad.title: Ship and Boat Captains and Operators

detailed.description: Command or supervise operations of ships and water vessels, such as tugboats and ferryboats. Required to hold license issued by U.S. Coast Guard.
detailed.title: Captains, Mates, and Pilots of Water Vessels

detailed.description: Operate small motor-driven boats. May assist in navigational activities.
detailed.title: Motorboat Operators

detailed.description: Supervise and coordinate activities of crew engaged in operating and maintaining engines, boilers, deck machinery, and electrical, sanitary, and refrigeration equipment aboard ship.
detailed.title: Ship Engineers

detailed.description: Operate and tend bridges, canal locks, and lighthouses to permit marine passage on inland waterways, near shores, and at danger points in waterway passages. May supervise such operations. Includes drawbridge operators, lock operators, and slip bridge operators.
detailed.title: Bridge and Lock Tenders

detailed.description: Park vehicles or issue tickets for customers in a parking lot or garage. May collect fee.
detailed.title: Parking Lot Attendants

detailed.description: Service automobiles, buses, trucks, boats, and other automotive or marine vehicles with fuel, lubricants, and accessories. Collect payment for services and supplies. May lubricate vehicle, change motor oil, install antifreeze, or replace lights or other accessories, such as windshield wiper blades or fan belts. May repair or replace tires.
detailed.title: Automotive and Watercraft Service Attendants

detailed.description: Conduct field studies to determine traffic volume, speed, effectiveness of signals, adequacy of lighting, and other factors influencing traffic conditions, under direction of traffic engineer.
detailed.title: Traffic Technicians

detailed.description: Inspect equipment or goods in connection with the safe transport of cargo or people. Includes rail transportation inspectors, such as freight inspectors; rail inspectors; and other inspectors of transportation vehicles, not elsewhere classified.
detailed.title: Transportation Inspectors

detailed.description: Provide services to ensure the safety and comfort of passengers aboard ships, buses, trains, or within the station or terminal. Perform duties such as greeting passengers, explaining the use of safety equipment, serving meals or beverages, or answering questions related to travel.
detailed.title: Transportation Attendants, Except Flight Attendants

detailed.description: All transportation workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Transportation Workers, All Other

detailed.description: Control or tend conveyors or conveyor systems that move materials or products to and from stockpiles, processing stations, departments, or vehicles. May control speed and routing of materials or products.
detailed.title: Conveyor Operators and Tenders

detailed.description: Operate mechanical boom and cable or tower and cable equipment to lift and move materials, machines, or products in many directions.
detailed.title: Crane and Tower Operators

broad.title: Dredge, Excavating, and Loading Machine Operators

detailed.description: Operate dredge to remove sand, gravel, or other materials in order to excavate and maintain navigable channels in waterways.
detailed.title: Dredge Operators

detailed.description: Operate or tend machinery equipped with scoops, shovels, or buckets, to excavate and load loose materials.
detailed.title: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operators

detailed.description: Operate underground loading machine to load coal, ore, or rock into shuttle or mine car or onto conveyors. Loading equipment may include power shovels, hoisting engines equipped with cable-drawn scraper or scoop, or machines equipped with gathering arms and conveyor.
detailed.title: Loading Machine Operators, Underground Mining

detailed.description: Operate or tend hoists or winches to lift and pull loads using power-operated cable equipment.
detailed.title: Hoist and Winch Operators

detailed.description: Operate industrial trucks or tractors equipped to move materials around a warehouse, storage yard, factory, construction site, or similar location.
detailed.title: Industrial Truck and Tractor Operators

detailed.description: Wash or otherwise clean vehicles, machinery, and other equipment. Use such materials as water, cleaning agents, brushes, cloths, and hoses.
detailed.title: Cleaners of Vehicles and Equipment

detailed.description: Manually move freight, stock, or other materials or perform other general labor. Includes all manual laborers not elsewhere classified.
detailed.title: Laborers and Freight, Stock, and Material Movers, Hand

detailed.description: Feed materials into or remove materials from machines or equipment that is automatic or tended by other workers.
detailed.title: Machine Feeders and Offbearers

detailed.description: Pack or package by hand a wide variety of products and materials.
detailed.title: Packers and Packagers, Hand

detailed.description: Operate steam, gas, electric motor, or internal combustion engine driven compressors. Transmit, compress, or recover gases, such as butane, nitrogen, hydrogen, and natural gas.
detailed.title: Gas Compressor and Gas Pumping Station Operators

detailed.description: Tend, control, or operate power-driven, stationary, or portable pumps and manifold systems to transfer gases, oil, other liquids, slurries, or powdered materials to and from various vessels and processes.
detailed.title: Pump Operators, Except Wellhead Pumpers

detailed.description: Operate power pumps and auxiliary equipment to produce flow of oil or gas from wells in oil field.
detailed.title: Wellhead Pumpers

detailed.description: Collect and dump refuse or recyclable materials from containers into truck. May drive truck.
detailed.title: Refuse and Recyclable Material Collectors

detailed.description: Operate diesel or electric-powered shuttle car in underground mine to transport materials from working face to mine cars or conveyor.
detailed.title: Mine Shuttle Car Operators

broad.title: Tank Car, Truck, and Ship Loaders

detailed.description: Load and unload chemicals and bulk solids, such as coal, sand, and grain into or from tank cars, trucks, or ships using material moving equipment. May perform a variety of other tasks relating to shipment of products. May gauge or sample shipping tanks and test them for leaks.
detailed.title: Tank Car, Truck, and Ship Loaders

detailed.description: All material moving workers not listed separately.
detailed.title: Material Moving Workers, All Other

minor.title: Military Officer Special and Tactical Operations Leaders

broad.title: Military Officer Special and Tactical Operations Leaders

detailed.description: Perform and direct in-flight duties to ensure the successful completion of combat, reconnaissance, transport, and search and rescue missions.
